description: A quick, practical guide to Spaced Repetition: Perfectly Timed Reviews.

hook.text: What if an algorithm knew exactly when you're about to forget somethingâ€”and quizzed you then?

buildup.text: Spaced repetition schedules reviews at increasing intervals: 1 day, 3 days, 7, 14, 30.

discovery.text: Reviewing right before forgetting forces maximum retrieval effort, strengthening the memory most.

twist.text: The technique was known for over a century but ignored until software made it practical.

climax.text: Medical students using Anki retain twice as much pharmacology as those using traditional study.

punchline.text: Forget at the right time and you'll remember forever.

quiz.question: What makes spaced repetition so effective?
options: Reviewing just before forgetting maximizes retrieval effort and memory strength
Studying the same material every day at the same time
Reducing the total number of reviews needed to zero
